intro: Cardiospermum palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glory species. Its fruit is a distinctive, inflated capsule that splits open to release its seeds. The plant is adapted to arid environments and has a long flowering period during the warmer months.
